sections.body: Scouts are cunning and resourceful, but still must prove themselves to higher-ranked drow before being considered anything but expendable.
sections.name: Drow Scouts

sections.other_gear: mwk studded leather, mwk shortbow and 20 arrows, short sword, 14 gp
sections.name: Drow Scout
sections.skills: Acrobatics +8, Climb +6, Disable Device +7, Knowledge (dungeoneering) +5, Knowledge (local) +4, Perception +8, Sense Motive +5, Stealth +8, Survival +3, Swim +5
sections.combat_gear: potion of cure light wounds, drow poison (2), tanglefoot bag

sections.other_gear: +1 studded leather, +1 composite shortbow with 20 arrows, mwk short sword, ring of protection +1, 136 gp
sections.feats: Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, Rapid Shot, Weapon Focus (short sword)

sections.body: During Combat A drow master scout focuses on disabling enemies—especially healers—with ranged attacks using sneak attacks, poison, and energy arrows.
sections.name: Tactics

sections.special_qualities: poison use, rogue talents (bleeding attack +4, fast stealth, sniper's eye, surprise attack)

sections.body: A house guard is better trained and equipped than a common warrior defending a drow city or caravan.
sections.name: Drow House Soldiers

sections.other_gear: mwk chain shirt, mwk longsword, repeating heavy crossbow with 20 mwk bolts, 47 gp
sections.feats: Deadly Aim, Exotic Weapon Proficiency (heavy repeating crossbow), Point-Blank Shot, Weapon Focus (longsword)

sections.body: During Combat The house guard uses alchemical weapons and poison against spellcasters.
sections.name: Tactics
Drow House Guard

sections.combat_gear: +1 frost bolts (6), potion of cure moderate wounds, acid (2), drow poison (4)

sections.body: The drow priest enjoys many blessings granted to her by the demon prince of forbidden magic.
sections.name: Drow Priest

sections.ac: 24, touch 13, flat-footed 23 (+9 armor, +2 deflection, +1 Dex, +2 shield)
sections.special_attacks: channel negative energy 7/day (DC 14, 3d6), hand of the acolyte (7/day)
sections.other_gear: mwk full plate, heavy steel shield, mwk flail, spell component pouch, 167 gp

spells.spell-like abilities:
(CL 5th)

Constant-detect magic

At will-dancing lights, deeper darkness, faerie fire, feather fall, levitate

1/day-dispel magic, divine favor, suggestion (DC 15)

spells.cleric spells prepared:
(CL 5th; concentration +9)

3rd-chain of perdition, dispel magic D, protection from energy

2nd-align weapon D (evil only), dread bolt (DC 16), hold person (DC 16), spiritual weapon

1st-cure light wounds, entropic shield, murderous command (DC 15), protection from good D, shield of faith

0 (at will)-bleed (DC 14), detect magic, detect poison, read magic

D domain spell; Domains Evil, Magic

sections.feats: Combat Casting, Extra Channel, Improved Initiative

sections.body:
Before Combat The priest casts shield of faith on herself. She prefers to let her minions do the fighting, and has them stand between her and any approaching foes.

During Combat The priest channels negative energy at groups of foes and uses single-target spells against her most dangerous opponent (typically starting with hold person so her allies can surround the hapless target).

Base Statistics Without shield of faith, the drow's statistics are

AC 22, touch 11, flat-footed 21.
sections.name: Tactics

sections.body: Having manipulated and assassinated her way into the middle ranks of her church, the drow priest uses her powers to eliminate rivals as she continues her climb. The drow religious orders are just as cutthroat as every other aspect of drow society. Their priests see the ability to out-scheme one's foes as a sign of the unholy favor of their demonic patrons.

sections.name: Drow Priest
sections.skills: Bluff +3, Diplomacy +6, Intimidate +7, Knowledge (arcana) +6, Knowledge (history) +6, Knowledge (nobility) +6, Knowledge (religion) +10, Perception +11, Sense Motive +12
sections.combat_gear: potion of invisibility, potion of owl's wisdom, scroll of cure moderate wounds, scroll of cure serious wounds, scroll of magic weapon

sections.body: Chosen by the most powerful nobles to serve as generals and bodyguards, demonic champions embody all of the brutal, cruel, and murderous impulses instilled in the drow race and valued by their society.
sections.name: Drow Demonic Champion

sections.special_attacks: channel negative energy (DC 18, 5d6), smite good 4/day (+3 attack and AC, +10 damage)
sections.other_gear: +1 full plate, +1 heavy steel shield, +1 scimitar, heavy crossbow with 10 mwk bolts, belt of giant strength +2, 69 gp

spells.antipaladin spells prepared:
(CL 7th; concentration +10)

3rd-litany of sight

2nd-invisibility, silence (DC 15)

1st-litany of sloth, murderous command (DC 14), protection from good

sections.feats: Channel Smite, Improved Critical (scimitar), Improved Initiative, Shield Focus, Weapon Focus (scimitar)

sections.body:
Before Combat The demonic champion casts invisibility and protection from good on herself, then uses her scroll of defile armor on her full plate. She prefers to use her fiendish boon ability to grant her scimitar the anarchic, flaming, unholy, or vicious weapon special ability.

During Combat The demonic champion uses smite good and Channel Smite with her scimitar attacks to harm foes, or uses her cruelties and touch of corruption to disable opponents. She casts silence to interfere with spellcasters employing ranged spells against her.
sections.name: Tactics

sections.body: A demonic champion has been tested by the powers of the Abyss and emerged stronger for it. Her soul is scarred by centuries of depraved acts, and she is irredeemable in her evil—something she is happy to prove. Demonic champions enjoy many creature comforts within drow society thanks to the spoils they claim in war, but their bloodlust motivates them to repeatedly return to battle.

sections.special_qualities: cruelties (dazed, nauseated, sickened, staggered), fiendish boon (weapon +2, 2/day), poison use, touch of corruption 8/day (5d6)
sections.name: Drow Demonic Champion
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Drow/Example Drow/Drow Demonic Champion/Drow Demonic Champion
sections.combat_gear: potion of cure serious wounds, potion of delay poison, potion of haste, scroll of defile armo r, scroll of invisibility, acid (2), alchemist's fire (2), antitoxin

sections.body: This drow makes use of deadly venoms and alchemy.
sections.name: Drow Poisoner

sections.ac: 23, touch 16, flat-footed 18 (+6 armor, +1 deflection, +5 Dex, +1 natural)
sections.special_attacks: bomb 19/day (6d6+5 fire and catch fire, DC 21, 10-ft. radius)
sections.other_gear: +2 chain shirt, mwk hand crossbow with 20 bolts, mwk rapier, amulet of natural armor +1, belt of incredible dexterity +2, cloak of resistance +1, headband of vast intelligence +2, ring of protection +1, 170 gp
sections.ranged: mwk hand crossbow +15 (1d4/19-20 plus poison) or bomb +14/+9 (6d6+5 fire)

spells.alchemist extracts prepared:
(CL 12th)

4th-cure critical wounds, fluid form, greater false life, greater invisibility

3rd-countless eyes, displacement, eruptive pustules (DC 18), haste, protection from energy

2nd-alchemical allocation, resist energy (2), see invisibility, touch injection, vomit swarm

1st-anticipate peril (DC 16), bomber's eye, negate aroma, polypurpose panacea (DC 16), shield, true strike (2)

sections.feats: Brew Potion, Extra Bombs, Improved Initiative, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, Quick Draw, Rapid Shot, Throw Anything

sections.body:
Before Combat The poisoner drinks her Dexterity mutagen and her extracts of anticipate peril, countless eyes, and greater invisibility .

Base Statistics Without the Dexterity mutagen, anticipate peril, and countless eyes, the drow's statistics are

Init +7

Senses no all-around vision

AC 21, touch 14, flat-footed 18

Ref +12

Will +6

Ranged mwk hand crossbow +13 (1d4/19–20 plus poison), or bomb +12/+7 (6d6+5 fire)

Dex 17

Wis 12

CMD 23

Skills Disable Device +17, Fly +11, Heal +10, Perception +18, Stealth +14, Survival +10.
sections.name: Tactics

sections.special_qualities: alchemy (alchemy crafting +12, identify potions), discoveries (explosive bomb, fast bombs, poison bomb [12 rounds/level], smoke bomb, strafe bomb, wings), mutagen (+4/-2, +2 natural, 120 minutes), poison use, swift alchemy, swift poisoning
sections.name: Drow Poisoner
sections.skills: Craft (alchemy) +20, Disable Device +19, Fly +13, Heal +9, Knowledge (arcana) +20, Knowledge (nature) +14, Perception +17, Spellcraft +20, Stealth +16, Survival +9, Use Magic Device +15
sections.combat_gear: potions of cure serious wounds (2), potion of gaseous form, potion of ghostly disguise, potion of invisibility, deathblade, dragon bile, drow poison (4), purple worm poison

sections.body: Born with unusual powers, the matron has survived coup attempts by countless rivals to remain the head of her house.
sections.name: Drow Matron

sections.ac: 25, touch 17, flat-footed 22 (+8 armor, +4 deflection, +2 Dex, +1 dodge)
sections.special_attacks: demonic channel 7/day (DC 19, 8d6 plus sicken or special), hand of the acolyte (10/day), scythe of evil (7 rounds, 2/day)
sections.other_gear: +2 mithral chainmail, +1 heavy mace, belt of incredible dexterity +2, headband of inspired wisdom +4, ring of protection +1, reliquary, spell component pouch, 183 gp

sections.body: This massive, three-headed clockwork snake is crafted of brass and strange, dark alloys.
sections.name: Abrakarn Viper
Special Abilities
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Drow/Example Drow/Abrakarn Viper/Abrakarn Viper/Special Abilities

sections.body: If an abrakarn viper confirms a critical hit against an opponent with its bite attack, the opponent must succeed at a DC 23 Will save or be confused for 1 round (as lesser confusion ). The save DC is Charisma-based and includes a +9 racial bonus.
sections.name: Confusing Critical
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Drow/Example Drow/Abrakarn Viper/Abrakarn Viper/Special Abilities/Confusing Critical

sections.body: Bound demonic life force animates the viper, giving it the chaotic and evil subtypes.
sections.name: Demon-Souled
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Drow/Example Drow/Abrakarn Viper/Abrakarn Viper/Special Abilities/Demon-Souled

sections.body: As long as an abrakarn viper and its diadem are on the same plane, the viper can unerringly find the diadem's wearer (or just the diadem, if it is removed).
sections.name: Find Master
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Drow/Example Drow/Abrakarn Viper/Abrakarn Viper/Special Abilities/Find Master

sections.body: If so ordered, an abrakarn viper defends the wearer of the diadem. All attacks against the diadem's wearer take a –2 penalty when the wearer is within the viper's melee reach.
sections.name: Guard
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Drow/Example Drow/Abrakarn Viper/Abrakarn Viper/Special Abilities/Guard

sections.body: An abrakarn viper's bite injects poison from a hidden reservoir within its body. The creator must refill this reservoir manually. The reservoir holds enough poison for three successful bite attacks, after which the creature merely deals bite damage. Refilling the reservoir takes 5 rounds and provokes attacks of opportunity. The creator can fill the reservoir with any injury poison (typically drow poison).
sections.name: Poison
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Drow/Example Drow/Abrakarn Viper/Abrakarn Viper/Special Abilities/Poison

sections.body: The wearer of an abrakarn viper's diadem can activate this ability as a standard action when within 100 feet of the viper. This ability transfers half the damage that would be dealt to the diadem's wearer to the viper (this ability does not provide the bonuses to AC or on saving throws granted by the spell of the same name). Damage transferred in this way bypasses any defensive abilities the viper possesses (such as immunity or damage reduction).
sections.name: Shield Other
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Drow/Example Drow/Abrakarn Viper/Abrakarn Viper/Special Abilities/Shield Other

sections.body: Demonic spirits imbue this serpentine construct with the unnatural power to protect anyone who wears its diadem of control.
An abrakarn viper's body and its diadem of control are built from 5,000 pounds of magically treated brass and rare metals costing 10,000 gp in total.

sections.special_qualities: demon-souled, find master, guard, shield other
sections.name: Abrakarn Viper

Construction.Requirements: Craft Construct, animate object, confusion, geas/quest, shield other
